intro: Rhysolepis gilliesii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical significance, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional Māori weaving.
